data.title: The Twilight Zone (1959–1964)
data.summary: Ordinary people find themselves in extraordinarily astounding situations, which they each try to solve in a remarkable manner.

data.title: Stranger Things (2016– )
data.summary: When a young boy disappears, his mother, a police chief, and his friends must confront terrifying forces in order to get him back.

data.title: Sacred Lies (2018– )
data.summary: A teenager with no hands is suspected of knowing who killed her cult's leader and lands in juvenile detention.

data.title: Hannibal (2013–2015)
data.summary: Explores the early relationship between the renowned psychiatrist and his patient, a young FBI criminal profiler, who is haunted by his ability to empathize with serial killers.

data.title: Supernatural (2005– )
data.summary: Two brothers follow their father's footsteps as "hunters", fighting evil supernatural beings of many kinds, including monsters, demons, and gods that roam the earth.

data.title: Ash vs Evil Dead (2015–2018)
data.summary: Ash has spent the last thirty years avoiding responsibility, maturity, and the terrors of the Evil Dead until a Deadite plague threatens to destroy all of mankind and Ash becomes mankind's only hope.

data.title: Castle Rock (2018– )
data.summary: Based on the stories of Stephen King, the series will intertwine characters and themes from the fictional town of Castle Rock.

data.title: The Walking Dead (2010– )
data.summary: Sheriff Deputy Rick Grimes wakes up from a coma to learn the world is in ruins, and must lead a group of survivors to stay alive.

data.title: The Originals (2013–2018)
data.summary: A family of power-hungry thousand year old vampires look to take back the city that they built and dominate all those who have done them wrong.

data.title: Are You Afraid of the Dark? (1990–2000)
data.summary: A group of kids get together in the woods, and tell ghost stories.

data.title: The League of Gentlemen (1999–2017)
data.summary: An interweaving narrative chronicling the antics of such diverse characters as: a transsexual taxi driver, a family obsessed with hygiene and toads, a fiery reverend, a carnival owner who kidnaps women into marriage, and a xenophobic couple who run a local shop for local people.

data.title: Bates Motel (2013–2017)
data.summary: A contemporary prequel to Psycho, giving a portrayal of how Norman Bates' psyche unravels through his teenage years, and how deeply intricate his relationship with his mother, Norma, truly is.

data.title: Penny Dreadful (2014–2016)
data.summary: Explorer Sir Malcolm Murray, American gunslinger Ethan Chandler, scientist Victor Frankenstein, and medium Vanessa Ives unite to combat supernatural threats in Victorian London.

data.title: The Exorcist (2016–2018)
data.summary: Follows three priests dealing with cases of a demonic presence targeting a family and a foster home.

data.title: Les Revenants (2012– )
data.summary: The Returned opens in a small mountain community which is rocked to its core when several local people who are presumed dead suddenly re-appear at their homes. Despite having passed away ...                See full summary »

data.title: American Horror Story (2011– )
data.summary: An anthology series centering on different characters and locations, including a house with a murderous past, an insane asylum, a witch coven, a freak show, a hotel, a possessed farmhouse, a cult, and the apocalypse.

data.title: The Terror (2018– )
data.summary: In 1848, two real life warships, HMS Terror and HMS Erebus, sent on a Royal Naval expedition to find the treacherous Northwest Passage become trapped in ice near Arctic and face starvation, mutiny, cannibalism and a demonic polar bear.

data.title: R.L. Stine's The Haunting Hour (2010–2014)
data.summary: R.L. Stine leads young viewers on a creepy tour of tales featuring life-sized dolls, werewolves, and carnival clowns that are stalking children.

data.title: The Addams Family (1964–1966)
data.summary: The misadventures of a blissfully macabre but extremely loving family.

data.title: Tales from the Crypt (1989–1996)
data.summary: Tales of horror based on the gruesome E.C. comic books of the 1950s presented by the legendary Crypt Keeper, a sinister ghoul obsessed with gallows humor and horrific puns.

data.title: Dark Shadows (1966–1971)
data.summary: The rich Collins family of Collinsport, Maine is tormented by strange occurrences.

data.title: Night Gallery (1969–1973)
data.summary: Rod Serling presents tales of horror illustrated in various paintings.

data.title: iZombie (2015– )
data.summary: A medical resident finds that being a zombie has its perks, which she uses to assist the police.

data.title: The Munsters (1964–1966)
data.summary: A family of friendly monsters have misadventures, never quite understanding why people react to them so strangely.

data.title: Grimm (2011–2017)
data.summary: A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces.

data.title: Santa Clarita Diet (2017– )
data.summary: Sheila and Joel are married real estate agents in Santa Clarita, California. When Sheila dies, their lives take a dark turn.

data.title: Goosebumps (1995–1998)
data.summary: A series of horror anthology stories based on the children's books by R.L. Stine.

data.title: The Outer Limits (1995–2002)
data.summary: A modern revival of the classic science fiction horror anthology show The Outer Limits (1963). Episodes often have twist-endings and involve aliens. Sometimes, a story from one episode continues in a later episode.

data.title: Being Human (2008–2013)
data.summary: A werewolf, a vampire and a ghost try to live together and get along.

data.title: The Vampire Diaries (2009–2017)
data.summary: A young teen struggles to make a decision between two vampire brothers and their supernatural lives. Soon after she discovers the truth her whole world turns upside down.

data.title: Teen Wolf (2011–2017)
data.summary: A somewhat awkward teen is attacked by a werewolf and inherits the curse himself, as well as the enemies that come with it.

data.title: Wellington Paranormal (2018– )
data.summary: Sergeant Maaka and Officers Minogue and O'Leary are members of the Wellington, New Zealand, police. Their job is to investigate paranormal phenomena.

data.title: Moonlight (2007–2008)
data.summary: A vampire lands work as a private investigator and falls for a mortal woman.

data.title: Haven (2010–2015)
data.summary: Everyone in the coastal town of Haven, Maine has a dormant curse or "trouble" that could trigger at any time for any reason. FBI agent Audrey Parker, the sheriff and the town's black sheep must deal with the troubles' deadly effects.

data.title: Constantine (2014–2015)
data.summary: A man struggling with his faith who is haunted by the sins of his past is suddenly thrust into the role of defending humanity from the gathering forces of darkness.

data.title: Masters of Horror (2005–2007)
data.summary: Anchor Bay has amassed some of the greatest horror film writers and directors to bring to you the anthology series, "Masters of Horror". For the first time, the foremost names in the horror...                See full summary »

data.title: Tales from the Darkside (1983–1988)
data.summary: A horror anthology series where the viewer is taken through ghost stories, science fiction adventures, and creepy, unexplained events.

data.title: Outcast (2016– )
data.summary: A young man searches for answers as to why he's been suffering from supernatural possessions his entire life.

data.title: Being Human (2011–2014)
data.summary: Three twenty-somethings share a house and try to live a normal life despite being a ghost, a werewolf, and a vampire.

data.title: Harper's Island (2009)
data.summary: Harper's Island was once the scene of a gruesome series of murders. Now, seven years later, family and friends gather on the island for a wedding, but one by one they begin to die.

data.title: The Strain (2014–2017)
data.summary: A mysterious viral outbreak with hallmarks of an ancient and evil strain of vampirism ravages the city of New York.

data.title: Fortitude (2015– )
data.summary: Perched on the edge of the Arctic Circle, Fortitude is one of the safest towns on earth. There has never been a violent crime here. Until now.

data.title: Sleepy Hollow (2013–2017)
data.summary: Ichabod Crane is resurrected and pulled two and a half centuries through time to unravel a mystery that dates all the way back to the founding fathers.

data.title: The Secret Circle (2011–2012)
data.summary: 16 year old Cassie Blake moves to Chance Harbor, Washington to live with her grandmother after her mother mysteriously dies. She discovers she's a witch along with 5 other teens.

data.title: Dracula (2013–2014)
data.summary: Dracula travels to London, with dark plans for revenge against those who ruined his life centuries earlier. However, his plan is complicated when he falls in love with a woman who seems to be a reincarnation of his dead wife.

data.title: Scream: The TV Series (2015– )
data.summary: A serialized anthology series that follows a group of teenagers being targeted by a masked serial killer.

data.title: Blood Drive (2017)
data.summary: In a dystopian alternate 1999, a former cop is forced to take part in a death race in which cars run on human blood as fuel.

data.title: Ghoul (2018– )
data.summary: In a totalitarian near-future India, a mysterious prisoner is sent to a remote military interrogation center where he turns the tables on his captors by exposing their most shameful secrets and unleashing a demon from Arabic folklore.

data.title: Hemlock Grove (2013–2015)
data.summary: Secrets are just part of daily life in the small Pennsylvania town of Hemlock Grove,where the darkest evils hide in plain sight.

data.title: Beauty and the Beast (2012–2016)
data.summary: A beautiful detective falls in love with an ex-soldier who goes into hiding from the secret government organization that turned him into a mechanically charged beast.

data.title: Channel Zero (2016– )
data.summary: An anthology series based on popular Internet Creepypastas, including Candle Cove, The No-End House, Butcher's Block and Hidden Door.

data.title: The Stand (1994)
data.summary: After a deadly plague kills most of the world's population, the remaining survivors split into two groups - one led by a benevolent elder and the other by a maleficent being - to face each other in a final battle between good and evil.

data.title: Stan Against Evil (2016– )
data.summary: An aging police sheriff begrudgingly joins an alliance with a new sheriff, Evie Barret, to battle angry demons haunting their small New Hampshire town.

data.title: Wolf Creek (2016– )
data.summary: An anthology series which centers on different characters being targeted by crazed serial killer Mick Taylor in the Australian outback.

data.title: Bitten (2014–2016)
data.summary: When she left Stonehaven - 'for good this time' - Elena Michaels thought she had left the world of supernatural behind. Until the night she got a mysterious call from her pack leader asking...                See full summary »

data.title: Scream Queens (2015–2016)
data.summary: A semi-anthology series that centers on returning characters being terrorized by a serial killer in different locations, including a university and a hospital.

data.title: The Returned (2015)
data.summary: A small town's residents are stunned when recently deceased locals begin returning from the dead. What should be a miracle soon becomes a nightmare.

data.title: The Lizzie Borden Chronicles (2015)
data.summary: Fictionalized account of actual events and people surrounding Lizzie Borden after her controversial acquittal of the double murder of her father and stepmother in 1892.

data.title: Fear the Walking Dead (2015– )
data.summary: A Walking Dead spin-off, set in Los Angeles, following two families who must band together to survive the undead apocalypse.

data.title: From Dusk Till Dawn: The Series (2014– )
data.summary: A Texas Ranger is in hot pursuit of the infamous Gecko brothers and their hostages. They all end up trapped in a desert bar secretly run by vampires and discover a vampire conspiracy.

data.title: It (1990)
data.summary: In 1960, seven pre-teen outcasts fight an evil demon who poses as a child-killing clown. Thirty years later, they reunite to stop the demon once and for all when it returns to their hometown.

data.title: Lore (2017– )
data.summary: Our collective nightmare mythologies are rooted in real-life horror stories.

data.title: Helix (2014–2015)
data.summary: A team of scientists are thrust into a potentially life-or-death situation when they arrive in the Arctic to secretly investigate what could be an outbreak of a strange disease in a secluded international research facility.

data.title: Bobcat Goldthwait's Misfits & Monsters (2018– )
data.summary: Anthology of stories told via different genres that satirize social norms and flawed characters.

data.title: Rose Red (2002)
data.summary: A group of people with psychic powers are invited to spend the night in a haunted house.

data.title: Dominion (2014–2015)
data.summary: Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity.

data.title: Z Nation (2014– )
data.summary: Three years after the zombie virus has gutted the United States of America a team of everyday heroes must transport the only known survivor of the plague from New York to California, where the last functioning viral lab waits for his blood.

data.title: Slasher (2016– )
data.summary: A young woman returns to the small town where her parents were murdered, only to find the past re-emerging as a new series of murders begins.

data.title: Freakish (2016– )
data.summary: A group of high schoolers struggles against predatory mutants who have taken over their town after a chemical plant meltdown.

data.title: Ravenswood (2013–2014)
data.summary: Five strangers are connected by the curse that has plagued Ravenswood for generations.

data.title: The Purge (2018– )
data.summary: Set in an altered United States, several unrelated people discover how far they will go to survive a night where all crime is legal for 12 hours.

data.title: Ghosted (I) (2017)
data.summary: A skeptical tough ex-cop is forced to team up with a nerdy scientist and firm believer of the paranormal. They must help a secret L.A.-based government agency deal with unexplained and paranormal occurrences.

data.title: Ghost Wars (2017–2018)
data.summary: A remote Alaskan town that has been overrun by paranormal forces and local outcast Roman Mercer (Jogia) must overcome the town's prejudices and his own personal demons if he's to harness ...                See full summary »

data.title: Dead of Summer (2016)
data.summary: In 1989, school is out for the summer. When Camp Stillwater's dark, ancient mythology awakens, what was supposed to be a summer of fun soon turns into one of unforgettable scares and evil at every turn.

data.title: The Shining (1997)
data.summary: A recovering alcoholic must wrestle with demons within and without when he and his family move into a haunted hotel as caretakers.

data.title: The Langoliers (1995)
data.summary: Most of the passengers on an airplane disappear, and the remainder land the plane in a mysteriously barren airport.

data.title: Room 104 (2017– )
data.summary: Set in a single room of an average American hotel, telling a different story of the assorted guests who pass through.

data.title: Van Helsing (2016– )
data.summary: Vanessa Helsing, distant relative of famous vampire hunter Abraham Van Helsing, is resurrected only to find that vampires have taken over the world.

data.title: The Mist (2017– )
data.summary: After an eerie mist rolls into a small town, the residents must battle the mysterious mist and its threats, fighting to maintain their morality and sanity.

data.title: Superstition (2017– )
data.summary: The supernatural drama centers around the Hastings family, owners of the only funeral home in the mysterious town of La Rochelle, Georgia. The family also acts as the keepers of the town's dark secrets and history.

data.title: Legacies (2018– )
data.summary: Hope Mikaelson, a tribrid daughter of a Vampire/Werewolf hybrid, makes her way in the world.

data.title: Chilling Adventures of Sabrina (2018– )
data.summary: A dark coming-of-age tale that follows Sabrina, as she wrestles to reconcile her dual nature as a half-witch, half-mortal while fighting evil forces.

data.title: The Haunting of Hill House (2018– )
data.summary: Based on the novel The Haunting of Hill House by Shirley Jackson.

data.title: The Passage (2018– )
data.summary: When a botched U.S. government experiment turns a group of death row inmates into highly infectious vampires, an orphan girl might be the only person able to stop the ensuing crisis.

data.title: Swamp Thing (2019– )
data.summary: The series will be based on the popular DC Comics character.

data.title: Nightflyers (2018– )
data.summary: A crew of space explorers embark on a mission to find a mysterious alien ship.
